pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [213424e972](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21810/commits/213424e972091f66016799270792067bc7c287da)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (83.00, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3442|-83|porting notes|

Current commit [213424e972](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/213424e972091f66016799270792067bc7c287da)
Reference commit [46717807bb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/46717807bb894147739482876600f738758b5628)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Testing out the action, since I cannot find Anne's action.

bors d=@grunweg

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13360100587/job/37308378133)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13360100587/job/37308378312)
Reviewed everything except Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Dual.lean; I have a couple of question this time to check some decisions are intentional.
Reviewed everything except Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Dual.lean; I have a couple of question this time to check some decisions are intentional.

Managed to get through everything everything, including `LinearAlgebra.Dual`. I agree with @grunweg's comments.

bors d=@grunweg
So, this porting note still "applies" but you declare it wontfix, right? Same a few lines below.
Yup, indeed.
Does the porting note still apply? Is it wontfix/not worth tracking?
I guess it is slightly mysterious why we can't combine the `rw` into the `simp`. But I think this is minor, and not needing the huge convert is satisfactory.
This porting note still seems relevant.
Does this still apply? Is it worth mentioning?
I'm confused how one would expect this to work without the `rw`, so I think it's fine to remove the porting note.

I think dot notation not working if the type cannot be found is still something of a regression from Lean 3. I would keep this porting note (also below).

Also, if Ya√´l had their way, we'd be turning the `LinearMapClass` argument to `LinearMap.ker` back into a plain linear map, so dot notation would also work then.
That is true. I was thinking that if we make that change, then we would need a systematic refactor anyways, and these few porting notes wouldn't be too helpful.

Hmm, I suppose there are indeed many more places where we would have to reapply dot notation. But I still prefer those places to be easily findable, and a porting note is one method. As long as there is some useful way to find dotnotationifiable occurrences, I'm not going to block merging this PR over this.
Yeah, I think we can find this automatically later if it becomes relevant.
Agreed that the new proof is not worse than the old proof.

The type hints can indeed be removed (otherwise I would keep the "apply‚Çó needs a little help to unify" part of the porting note.)
```suggestion
      (apply‚Çó (c j)) ‚àò‚Çó (apply‚Çó (b i)) ‚àò‚Çó lcurry R M N R
```

```suggestion
        eq_empty_of_subset_empty <|
          -- Porting note: `-inter_subset_left, -subset_inter_iff` required.
```

```suggestion
  -- Porting note: ‚àë (i) (j) does not seem to work; apply‚Çó needs a little help to unify
  ‚àë i, ‚àë j,
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(LinearAlgebra): process a first batch of porting notes
